page.title: 04Education in Gwyddelwern
page.content: The primary school is on the outskirts of the village, it is{bi-lingual}but the lessons are taught in{Welsh. The building was built over 100 years ago of red brick. There are two classes the Infants 4 - 7 year olds and the primary 8 - 11 years old. The Headmistress is in charge of the primary children and the Deputy the infants. In September 1985, there was{35} children,{21}in the primary and{14}in the infants. The larger room is used at lunch time. There are 2 Cooks who make the lunch in an excellent kitchen. There is also a lunchtime assistant. There is a part-time Secretary and a crossing partrol man. Children who live over 2 miles away are transported to school by taxi. Mrs A. Lloyd Jones
